page.title: 06CUSTOMS-LOCAL.
page.content: At midnight on Hogmanay (31st Dec) all of the ships and boats in the dock blow their horns to celebrate the beginning of a new year. To celebrate Christmas (25th Dec) some of the local shops give presents to local Children's Homes. Schools sometimes make up food parcels or give presents to pensioners of the area. Fetes are held regularly within the area. St Kenneth's school hold a fete to raise money for school funds or charities. The Lady Octavia Park hold a fete every year to help their play scheme. The fetes usually include stalls which sell goods such as home baking, food stuffs, second hand goods and books. Also there might be games for people to play and a beauty competition. Many churches hold fetes in summertime.
